intro: Gnaphalium corymbosum, commonly known as the clustered everlasting, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish to white flowers that are arranged in dense, spherical clusters, giving it its common name. It is often found in moist meadows, prairies, and along streambanks. Gnaphalium corymbosum is known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in herbal remedies.
